channel.title: Backy on A tool for commands
channel.description: Recent content in Backy on A tool for commands

item.title: Getting started
item.description: If you have not installed Backy, see the install documentation.

item.title: Configuring Backy
item.description: This is the section on the config file. To use a specific file: backy backup -f /path/to/file If you leave the config path blank, the following paths will be searched in order: ./backy.yml ./backy.yaml ~/.config/backy.yml ~/.config/backy.yaml Create a file at ~/.config/backy.yml. See the documentation in this section to configure it.

item.title: CLI
item.description: This page lists documentation for the CLI. Subcommands backy backup Backup executes commands defined in config file. Use the --lists flag to execute the specified commands. If not specified, all lists will be executed. Usage: backy backup [--lists=list1,list2] [flags] Flags: -h, --help help for backup -l, --lists strings Accepts comma-separated names of command lists to execute. Global Flags: -f, --config string config file to read from -v, --verbose Sets verbose level backy exec Exec executes commands defined in config file.

item.title: Repositories
item.description: The repo mirrors are: https://git.andrewnw.xyz/CyberShell/backy https://git.vern.cc/cybershell/backy https://github.com/CybersShell/backy
